intro: Notopleura standleyana, commonly known as the purple-veined orchid, is a species of orchid native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking violet and green foliage, which features prominent veins that give it its common name. The plant produces delicate, fragrant flowers with a distinctive purple-pink coloration. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts interested in rare orchids.
